storyInfo: Humus finds himself shunned because of his past at an exhibition, but he expresses himself in his own way.

attributes.content: Do I speak into this? Hello? Hello!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: There's no need to smack it, Mr. Humus. We've set it up for you.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Just an old habit from working on my gadgets. Sometimes there's a loose part so you have to smack 'em to get 'em to work.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Well, you shouldn't have to worry about that here at the exhibition. It's being sponsored by the top tech firms in Trimounts.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: (I can't exactly tell her I was being cheap so I used a bunch of second-hand parts...)
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Oh, right... did you have a question?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Yes, getting back on topic... Your participation here has drawn a lot of attention. Many people are exceptionally... curious, about your experiences and what you've made.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Well, then I should introduce the gadgets I have with me here!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: First, this automatic clothes hanger. We've all forgotten about clothes we left out to dry, right? And sometimes they just get dirty again.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: So I modified this hanger to fold up your clothes once it senses they're dry enough, and then this device down here tosses 'em into the wardrobe.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Like that!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Whoops, it caught your camera? Sorry, let me recalibrate it and try again.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: There's a long story behind this hanger. I made it to help the elderly and disabled—
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Ahem... the demonstration can wait, Mr. Humus. I have a few other questions for you first.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I noticed you used the word 'modify' to describe your product, rather than 'invent,' like everyone else.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Did I? I said 'modify'?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Yes, you did. What I wanted to ask is: Did you get permission from the patent holder before modifying it?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Huh? I bought them as a pack at the supermarket for ten bucks.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Did you now?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I see you didn't even consider that before 'modifying' your product.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I-I guess I didn't...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Does your background have anything to do with your lack of awareness of intellectual property rights?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: W-What does that have to do with anything? They were just ordinary clothes hangers!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: In Trimounts, there can be extraordinary value in the most ordinary things, Mr. Humus.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Er... you're right! Absolutely. I agree.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: ...Then shouldn't you respect the rights of the patent holder?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I-I've never had to deal with that kind of stuff...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Would it be correct to assume that you have virtually no understanding of patents because of your years of penal service on the frontier?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I... I mean, I know what they are, at least...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Then do you mean to say that you do understand patents, but intentionally—
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Excuse me, ma'am, but I have urgent business with this big fellow here.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Oh... very well.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Should I come back to finish the interview later? I haven't said everything I wanted to.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: (Whisper) Just go! Don't you understand? She just wants to tear you apart.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: It wasn't that bad. It was nothing compared to the sort of stuff you hear all the time on the frontier.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: You're just... Never mind.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Are you Mr. Humus? It's such an honor to meet you. Chris talks about you all the time.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Let me introduce you to my university professor. I sent him the files on the stuff you made at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: A professor? Oh my god, I'm so excited to meet someone so intellectual!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: No need to be humble, sir. I looked through what Chris sent me, and was amazed at the creativity they demonstrated.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Aw, that was just some scrap I threw together. But you can see my latest stuff at my display.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: No need to rush, Mr. Humus, I'll be here all day. But there's something I should tell you first.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Well, now you're scaring me. Where I'm from, that's what people say when they're about to deliver bad news.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Hahaha, quite the opposite, my friend!
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Although there were more than a few rough edges in what I've seen of your work, company management was flabbergasted by some of the optimizations you made.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: (Whisper) Flabber-what now...?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: (Whisper) They were amazed.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Aw, shucks...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: We've had an eye out for new ways to conserve and recycle resources, and your energy-saving module is precisely what we're looking for.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: So you want to...?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: We want to help you continue to improve the module and apply it to our products. You will, of course, be appropriately compensated. What do you think?
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: How could I say no to that?! Getting recognized for my work is a dream come true, not to mention you're a friend of Chris.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Excellent. I like people who are easy to do business with.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Guess I better jot down all the thoughts and experiences I had on the way. Wouldn't wanna embarrass myself at the presentation, after all.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Regarding that... there's another tiny matter I must discuss with you.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: I'm all ears!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: We'd like to ask you to remain behind the scenes, and allow... others to go public with this technology.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: But why? I'm the one who made it. Would anyone else even know how to describe it?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: I'm simply saying it would be announced under somebody else's name. You won't be required to present anything. But don't worry, you will receive full compensation.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: But I wanted to talk about my experience inventing it... All the fun stuff that went into it.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: What I mean is... we would like to separate your identity from your work.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: You mean people'll use the stuff I make, but won't know it was me?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Does that really matter? You'll have your money.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: I'm not so sure about this, prof. All the credit would go to the one who lent their name to it.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Well, we have to think about the company's image. Mr. Humus's past is a little... complicated, after all.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Hey! What's that supposed to—
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Humus raises his voice, as though someone just stepped on his toes.
He then realizes that everyone in the room has their eyes on him.
Seeing everyone keep their distance and avert their gazes, Humus swallows what he was about to say.
Don't judge people by their cover, prof. I've spent a lot of time with Humus this past year, and I guarantee you he's not that kind of guy!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Chris...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Not to mention he was imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: (Pats the engineer's shoulder)
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Thanks for having my back, bro, but there's no need to get mad. I'm sure your professor didn't mean it like that.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Yes, there's no need to get agitated, Chris.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: This decision was made out of purely practical considerations. I assure you I have nothing against Mr. Humus himself.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Well, sir, I'm glad you think so highly of my ability, and if you're willing to buy, I'm willing to sell. But there are a lot of folks here. How 'bout we find some time to talk after the exhibition?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Certainly. It was a pleasure meeting you. We'll speak later.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Humus...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Thanks, bro. I'll buy you lunch once I've got the cash. Just keep it cheap.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Hmm... This wasn't what I had in mind when Chris said there'd be free food here.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: How am I supposed to fill my belly with snacks the size of my fingernail?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Excuse me, you got any meat?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: We have meatballs with berry sauce right over there, sir.
attributes.name: Exhibition Staff

attributes.content: Not that tiny stuff. Anything bigger?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: I'm sorry, sir, but we're only serving hors d'oeuvre and drinks today.
attributes.name: Exhibition Staff

attributes.content: Hors d'...? N-Never mind.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Well, I guess snacks are better than nothing.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Mm, this dessert ain't half bad... No wonder the girls always go for sweets when they're in a bad mood.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: It really does pick you right up.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Ooh, this cookie is great! If only it was bigger.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: And this mini burger... yum!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Man, this cupcake is amazing!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: This exhibition is going down the drain. Just look at the riff-raff you're letting in now.
attributes.name: Arrogant Exhibition Guest

attributes.content: Who might you be referring to?
attributes.name: Aloof Exhibition Planner

attributes.content: That man from the frontier processing station, of course. Who else?
attributes.name: Arrogant Exhibition Guest

attributes.content: Oh, him... Did you see his display? I was too busy to visit.
attributes.name: Aloof Exhibition Planner

attributes.content: I took a look. All scrap, not even worth my time.
attributes.name: Arrogant Exhibition Guest

attributes.content: Figured as much, seeing how uncouth he is. Did you hear him yelling earlier? Nearly scared the daylights out of the other guests.
attributes.name: Aloof Exhibition Planner

attributes.content: And look at him now, gorging on appetizers like he hasn't eaten in years.
attributes.name: Arrogant Exhibition Guest

attributes.content: (Whisper) Don't they even know to keep their voices down when trash talking someone behind their back?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: (Whisper) Or I guess they don't even care what I think...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: (Whisper) Well, whatever. Food comes first.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Hey, ain't that the reporter who wanted to interview me? Ma'am? Ma'am?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Looks like she's busy...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: At today's exhibition, the Cole Workshop took home four prizes for innovation and quality.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: This bracelet earned particular acclaim, winning Best Product in a unanimous decision.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Now, let us meet the inventor, Mrs. Yuria.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Best Product? This I gotta hear.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: What's with all these people? Are they all here to listen, too? Hey, stop pushing!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Can you tell us more about this bracelet, Mrs. Yuria?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Of course. This smart bracelet helps schools and parents keep track of children in real time.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: It records various data, including movement, activity, health, and academic performance, etc.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: With all that, parents and teachers could even tell how many times the kids have gone to the bathroom.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Precisely.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: That sounds like a wonderful product, helping parents understand what is going on with their child.
attributes.name: Investor

attributes.content: Ain't that just a monitoring bracelet?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: So what inspired you to invent this?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: My own son closed himself off when he entered adolescence, refusing to tell us, his parents, what he was thinking.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: So I invented this in order to get to know him better.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: The very model of a responsible mother!
attributes.name: Investor

attributes.content: ...Responsible? That's just monitoring.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Are there any other, more general applications for the bracelet?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Of course. I have full confidence in that.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: I could use that in my office. An employer should know what his employees are up to.
attributes.name: Investor

attributes.content: Are you kidding me, sir?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: It's just a goddamn monitoring bracelet!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Around Humus, people are talking excitedly about potential applications for the bracelet.
Their discussions drown out his voice.
And any who might have heard him paid no heed.
You...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Get moving, people! Now put these on!
attributes.name: Vicious Soldier

attributes.content: (Whisper) What are they handing out?
attributes.name: Processing Station Prisoner

attributes.content: (Whisper) Don't ask me. I was just working when they told me to come here.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: (Whisper) What were you up to this time?
attributes.name: Processing Station Prisoner

attributes.content: (Whisper) I made a gadget that can adjust how tight the shackles are, to make them a little comfier...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Don't even think about running away once you've got these new shackles on. The moment the positioning tracker finds you're outside the station...
attributes.name: Vicious Soldier

attributes.content: Boom! There goes your leg. And don't even think about sabotaging them either, or else... kaboom!
attributes.name: Vicious Soldier

attributes.content: (Whisper) Well, I guess that was a waste of time.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: You dirtbags just keep your heads down and work your asses off. Don't even dream of slacking off either, 'cause these new shackles are gonna know.
attributes.name: Vicious Soldier

attributes.content: You're even putting those on a kid that young?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Shut your trap!
attributes.name: Vicious Soldier

attributes.content: Ouch... This thing sure delivers a hella nasty electric shock...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Let's just go, mister. Don't say anything else.
attributes.name: Skinny Boy

attributes.content: Who are you calling mister? I'm not even twenty. The name's Humus.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Humus...
attributes.name: Skinny Boy

attributes.content: Don't you worry, I've got your back in this here station. I'm not letting any of the big guys bully you.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: But shit, they're sending kids like you here now?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Thanks, Humus.
attributes.name: Skinny Boy

attributes.content: So how'd you end up here at your age?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Mom stole food and got caught...
attributes.name: Skinny Boy

attributes.content: But my little brother and sister need her... so I volunteered...
attributes.name: Skinny Boy

attributes.content: Well... let's get going. I'll have old Lippi arrange a bed for you. Can't have a kid like you sleeping on cardboard boxes like the rest of us dumbasses.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Man, I had to wait an hour for the guards to get off work.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Lemme check...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Yup, here it is.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Just a normal warehouse? Wasn't this place supposed to be cutting edge? No fingerprint lock, no password? All you need is a card.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Well, I should thank that dude for 'sharing' it. Hope he won't miss it much.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Now it's my turn.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Goddamn, are they even gonna have time to hand out all these awards at tomorrow's ceremony?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Most Innovative, Most Disruptive, Top 10 Hardcore Tech... ah, Best Product.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Let's see what's inside this baby...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Knew it. Almost the exact same thing as the shackles I used to wear.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: These people are outta their minds. They're gonna starting treating innocent kids like criminals now?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Not on my watch.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Under the dim moonlight, Humus reassembles the bracelet, then takes out an identical bracelet from his pocket.
The cold glint of metal stings his eyes.
He fiddles with the bracelets before putting one of them back on the shelf, and the other underneath it.
He looks to the sides and nods once satisfied that the bracelet underneath cannot be easily spotted. And then sighs.
*Sigh*...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: How could they treat innocent people like criminals?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: *Yawn* Did the awards ceremony have to be so early in the morning?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Well, I got you an appointment with another big shot who's also interested in your energy-saving module, and this guy has a reputation for being easy-going.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Now, it is my pleasure to announce the winner of the Best Product award.
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: (Sits up straight) Mm...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: What's that? You sure woke up in a hurry.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Shh, don't talk while they're talking!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Mrs. Yuria, could you please step up and demonstrate your smart bracelet?
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: With all the distinguished inventors present, I'd be honored to.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: Yeesh, why there gotta be so many people in front?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: As you can see, we've gone with a minimalist style, despite the rich functionality of the product.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: The goal is to reduce extraneous steps and allow for intuitive operation.
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: (Whisper) Come on, talk about that little button!
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: All it takes is the press of a button to open it...
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: (Whisper) Just press it already...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Hm? It's not responding...
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: Whoops, forgot it always takes a little smack to get my stuff working...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Maybe it ran out of batteries. Let me find my charging cord...
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: The woman tosses the bracelet onto the table and reaches into her bag for a cord, only to see the bracelet begin to bounce on the table.
Before she can react, it flies into the air and starts spraying colorful sparks in all directions.
The audience looks on, dumbfounded, as the bracelet continues to spin in the air and spit out fireworks.
(Whisper) Come on, don't just watch...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Humus reaches into his pocket and pushes the remote control's slider up to max.
Orchestral music begins to play from the bracelet, and soon the hall is filled with a soaring soprano solo.
The members of the audience look at each other incredulously.
This isn't right... what's going on?
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: Yeah, that's not right... it's one of those hoity-toity songs Czerny recommended.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: That's no good at all. Should be something funner.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Humus presses a button on his remote control.
The orchestra stops, replaced by a lively electronic dance tune.
♪Wave your left hand, hey, left hand♪
♪If you're feelin' the joy today♪
♪Shake your right foot, oh, right foot♪
♪Get drunk on this beautiful night♪
Security! Grab that bracelet! What is the meaning of this, Mrs. Yuria?
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: I-I have no idea!
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: Eek! It's flying towards me! Security!
attributes.name: Lanky Inventor

attributes.content: Just stay put! It's not moving! Hey! Hey!
attributes.name: MC

attributes.content: Hehe...
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: What's so funny?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Look at all this chaos. Ain't it hilarious?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Well gee, I wonder whose fault this could be...?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Haha, yeah... me too.
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Still...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: While I can't say which of my coworkers did this, I can say that his taste in music is...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer

attributes.content: Top notch?
attributes.name: Humus

attributes.content: Abysmal!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Engineer
